content.question: Which of the following best describes why carbon dioxide has a significant effect on global climate change?

choices.label: Carbon dioxide is a highly reactive molecule.
Carbon dioxide is the largest contributor to anthropogenic greenhouse gas emissions.
Carbon dioxide has the highest global warming potential of all gases in the atmosphere.
Carbon dioxide reflects infrared radiation, which gradually heats the Earthâ€™s surface.

content.answer: Carbon dioxide is the largest contributor to anthropogenic greenhouse gas emissions.
